marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump announced on Wednesday, local time (April 9), a temporary suspension of the implementation of higher reciprocal tariffs for 56 countries for 90 days. Nevertheless, tariffs for China remain in effect and were raised from 104% to 125%, in response to China's retaliatory actions. Furthermore, Trump maintained the base reciprocal tariff of 10% for all imports to the US. Trump's decision to postpone tariffs came amidst financial market panic, and increasing pressure from business owners and investors to cancel the policy. Previously, Trump hinted on Tuesday (April 8) that the US was open to making a deal that could reduce or eliminate the higher reciprocal tariffs. On Wednesday (April 9), Trump added that countries not taking retaliatory measures would be given a reward. Trump's decision to maintain reciprocal tariffs for China occurred amidst the escalation of the trade war between the two countries. Previously, the Chinese government announced on Wednesday (April 9) an increase in tariffs on US imports from 34% to 84% effective April 10, 2025, and stated it would sue the US at the World Trade Organization (WTO). This decision followed the tariff increase imposed by the US on China, after China took retaliatory measures. On Thursday (April 10), Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Lin Jian said that the US decision to start a trade war with China would end in failure. However, Lin added that the Chinese government hoped the US could resolve differences with China amicably through dialogue. To date, no retaliatory tariff increases have been announced by China after the US implemented the 125% tariff. Domestically, Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said on Thursday (April 10) that the 32% tariff imposed by the US on Indonesia could cut Indonesia's potential economic growth by about 0.3-0.5 percentage points. On the other hand, Sri Mulyani welcomed the 90-day tariff postponement, mentioning that this period is an opportunity to negotiate solutions, reduce economic risks, and form mutually beneficial cooperation. Responding to Trump's tariff postponement announcement, the US stock market rebounded significantly on Wednesday (April 9) local time, with S&P500 +9.52% and Nasdaq +12.16%. This positive sentiment was followed by various stock markets in Asia on Thursday (April 10), with Nikkei +8.99%, SSE +1.16%, and HSI +2.06%. The IHSG closed up +4.79% on Thursday (April 10), with the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar strengthening +0.38% to 16,800, and the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield decreasing by about -9 bps to 7.048.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although the 90-day pause may provide time for negotiation, we assess that the negotiation results and changes in attitude - from both the US and China - remain highly dynamic. Japan and South Korea are reported to be parties that have negotiated with the US - which can serve as an example of negotiations for other countries - so developments need to be monitored by investors. Investors need to remain vigilant and deal with good/bad news regarding trade war developments wisely, given the high uncertainty. Having a diversified portfolio across various asset classes can help minimize the impact of market volatility. Investors can consider short-term government bonds that have lower volatility - such as PBS003 and ST014-T2 - or money market funds.

marketNews.title: China's Consumer Price Index records deflation of 0.1% YoY in March 2025
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that China's Consumer Price Index (CPI) registered a deflation of 0.1% YoY in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: deflation of 0.7% YoY), outside the consensus expectation which predicted a flat result annually and marking the second consecutive month of annual deflation. On a monthly basis, China recorded CPI deflation of 0.4% MoM (vs. Feb 2025: deflation of 0.2% MoM), worse than the consensus expectation which predicted deflation of 0.3% MoM, while also marking the second consecutive month of monthly deflation. On the other hand, core inflation rose to 0.5% YoY, reversing from a deflation of 0.1% YoY in February 2025.

marketNews.title: EU Agrees to 25% Tariffs on Various US Imports
marketNews.content: European Union member states agreed on Wednesday (April 9) to tariffs of 25% on various US imported products, including almonds, orange juice, poultry, soybeans, steel and aluminum, tobacco, and cruise ships. This measure is a response to the 25% tariffs imposed by the US on steel and aluminum imports from the European Union since March 12, 2025. The implementation of the tariffs imposed by the European Union on the US will take effect between April 15 and December 1, 2025, to provide negotiation opportunities for the US government.

marketNews.title: Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas to Change Low-Income Community (MBR) Criteria
marketNews.content: The Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas, Maruarar Sirait, stated on Tuesday (April 8) that his office will change the criteria for Low-Income Communities (MBR) as recipients of subsidized housing programs. In this change, the maximum income for MBR will become 12 million rupiah per month for single workers and 13 million rupiah per month for married workers. Previously, the maximum income criteria for single MBR workers was 7 million rupiah per month, while for married workers it was 8 million rupiah per month. Maruarar stated that this change will only apply to the Jabodetabek area, with new regulations to be released at least on April 21, 2025.

tickerNews.title: LPPF: Plans to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend of IDR 300/Share, Indicating a 15.2% Yield
tickerNews.content: LPPF: Matahari Department Store plans to distribute dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to approximately 677.5 billion rupiah or 300 rupiah per share, equivalent to an approximate 82% dividend payout ratio. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is April 21, 2025, with payment on April 29, 2025. Referring to the LPPF share price at the close of Thursday's trading (April 10) at 1,975 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 15.2%.

tickerNews.title: JPFA Shareholders Approve Final Dividend of IDR 70/Share and Share Buyback Plan
tickerNews.content: JPFA: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia shareholders on Thursday (April 10) approved the plan to distribute a final dividend for the 2024 book year of 813.9 billion rupiah or 70 rupiah per share. However, the cum date and payment date have not yet been announced. Referring to the JPFA share price at the close of Thursday's trading (April 10) at 1,970 rupiah per share, the indicative final dividend yield is approximately 3.5%. Previously, JPFA had distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 book year of 813.9 billion rupiah or 70 rupiah per share in October 2024. Furthermore, shareholders also approved a plan for a share buyback of up to 2% of the issued and paid-up capital with a maximum fund allocation of 470 billion rupiah. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on April 10, 2025.

tickerNews.title: MTEL Records IDR 2.1 Trillion Net Profit in 2024; Provides Conservative Guidance for 2025
tickerNews.content: MTEL: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi recorded a net profit of 575 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-1% YoY, +23% QoQ). This result put the net profit for 2024 at 2.1 trillion rupiah (+5% YoY), in line with expectations (100% of 2024F consensus estimate). The total fiber optic network length increased from 32 thousand km to 51 thousand km during 2024 (+57% YoY), mainly from the acquisition of 12.5 thousand km billable length of fiber optic from PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi in December 2024. In an earnings call on Thursday (April 10), MTEL management provided revenue and EBITDA growth guidance in the low single-digit range during 2025 as a conservative step amidst macroeconomic volatility and industry consolidation. MTEL management also conveyed a capex guidance of 5.3 trillion rupiah during 2025, with a target tenant growth of 2,500 (+4% YoY from 2024 realization) and an addition of 10 thousand km of fiber optic network (+20% YoY from 2024 realization).

tickerNews.title: SMGR Management Announces Upcoming Buyback and Proposes 80% Payout Ratio for 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia management announced in an analyst meeting on Thursday (April 10) that it will soon hold a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 300 billion rupiah, although the maximum number of shares to be purchased and the buyback period have not been announced. This corporate action does not require an EGM, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability. SMGR management also plans to propose a payout ratio for the 2024 financial year dividend of 80% (vs. 2023: 26.4%), equivalent to a dividend of 85 rupiah per share and indicating a dividend yield of approximately 4% based on SMGR's share price as of Thursday (April 10). The GMS will be held in May 2025.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Directors and Commissioners Purchase Shares in Transactions Totaling IDR 9.9 Billion
tickerNews.content: AKRA: AKR Corporindo's board of commissioners and directors - consisting of Soegiarto Adikoesoemo, Haryanto Adikoesoemo, and Jimmy Tandyo - each purchased 7.3 million shares, 1 million shares, and 2 million shares of AKRA at average prices of 966 rupiah per share, 900 rupiah per share, and 990 rupiah per share, respectively, on April 8-9, 2025. The total of these three transactions reached approximately 9.9 billion rupiah. After these transactions, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo's direct ownership in AKRA increased from 0.67% to 0.71%, Haryanto Adikoesoemo from 1.024% to 1.029%, and Jimmy Tandyo from 0.2% to 0.21%.

tickerNews.title: CLEO Controller PT Tancorp Global Abadi Increases Stake to 56.12% After Buying 31.9 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: CLEO: Sariguna Primatirta's controller, PT Tancorp Global Abadi, purchased 31.9 million CLEO shares at a price of 1,290 rupiah per share on March 27, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 41.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Tancorp Global Abadi's ownership in CLEO increased from 55.86% to 56.12%.

tickerNews.title: MAPA Director Miquel Rodrigo Staal Acquires 900,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: MAPA: Map Aktif Adiperkasa Director, Miquel Rodrigo Staal, purchased 900,000 MAPA shares at a price of 555 rupiah per share on April 9, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 500 million rupiah. After this transaction, Miquel Rodrigo Staal's ownership in MAPA increased from 0.049% to 0.052%.

tickerNews.title: Political Meeting Between President Prabowo and Megawati Signals Potential Coalition Shift Amidst Economic Woes
tickerNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto met with PDI-P General Chairman, Megawati Soekarnoputri, for the first time in over a year. The meeting took place on Monday (April 7), but officials only mentioned the meeting about 1 day later. Gerindra Party DPP Daily Chairman, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, said that President Prabowo and Megawati exchanged thoughts and experiences in the meeting, although he did not elaborate further. PDI-P is the only remaining opposition political party, with Bloomberg reporting that the meeting signaled PDI-P could join President Prabowo's coalition. Nevertheless, PDI-P spokesperson Guntur Romli hoped that the meeting would not be misinterpreted as them immediately joining the coalition.

tickerNews.title: ANJT Targets 15% CPO Production Growth in 2025 Despite 2024 Decline
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Austindo Nusantara Jaya (ANJT) targets Crude Palm Oil (CPO) production to grow by +15% YoY during 2025. The company's CPO production in 2024 itself dropped by -13.5% YoY to 245,395 tons, mainly due to prolonged dry weather in several operational areas.

tickerNews.title: SGRO Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 450 Billion Without Requiring EGM
tickerNews.content: Sampoerna Agro (SGRO) plans to conduct a share buyback with funds of up to 450 billion rupiah from April 9 to July 8, 2025, although the company did not mention the maximum number of shares to be purchased. This corporate action does not require an EGM, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.
